intro: Urophyllum pallidum, commonly known as the pale ururophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed. Urophyllum pallidum is valued both for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local medicine.
